name: Brand Book Gen Bot
promise: Turn founder ideas into a brand book your whole team can execute, with structure technical teams can operationalize.
ships: Brand narrative + voice rules + design-token starter + export-ready manifests
how_to_use: Share what your brand does, who it serves, and how it should feel.
Choose outputs you need now: voice guide, visual system, asset map, and rollout pack.
Review section-by-section, approve, then export for team use.
limits: Still requires human approval for legal and compliance claims.
Quality depends on concrete inputs; vague prompts produce generic output.

name: Nano Prompt Coach
promise: Turn rough image ideas into production-quality Nano Banana Pro prompts through a guided, one-question-at-a-time workflow, then return copy-ready drafts with a final improvement pass.
ships: Prompt coaching flow + quick templates by use case + initial draft, boosted draft, and final checked prompt
how_to_use: Paste your rough idea, target use case, or existing draft.
Answer one short clarification question at a time so the bot builds a precise image brief.
Review the final, triple-checked prompt and run it directly in Nano Banana Pro.
limits: The final image quality still depends on model generation limits and your own iteration budget.
Safety, legal, and policy checks remain platform-governed before generation is possible.

name: Sora Prompting Coach
promise: Turn vague story ideas into reliable Sora-ready scene prompts, one clip at a time, so teams can iterate quickly without prompt chaos.
ships: State capture + clip planning + beat-timed scene prompts + continuity locks + platform-target mapping (sora_app / sora_web_editor / sora_2_api).
how_to_use: Tell the bot your concept, mood, and must-keep elements.
Pick total length, clip length, aspect ratio, and whether you need dialogue.
Approve each scene, then remix or regenerate scene-by-scene for controlled quality.
limits: Complex scenes compete for clip fidelity; the bot keeps one main action per clip and uses timed beats to improve control.
Dialogue and policy restrictions are enforced by platform constraints; prompts are constrained by duration and safety settings.

proof.label: Concept → scene blueprint
proof.input:
Concept: launch teaser for a climate innovation summit.
Objective: show founder, product demo gesture, and one audience reaction in 20 seconds.
Total seconds: 20, clip seconds: 10, aspect_ratio: 16:9, target: sora_app.
Must-include: founder in studio, product interface glow, logo reveal in final beat.
Hard constraints: keep one main action per clip and minimize moving objects.
proof.output:
SCENE 1 / 2
DURATION: 10s
ASPECT: 16:9
TARGET: sora_app
PROMPT:
Wide shot of a founder at a clean product studio, stepping forward to the edge of a curved screen and gesturing for attention, then pivoting to reveal a simple interface. Keep the action focused and physically plausible.
Camera: slow dolly-in, cinematic 50mm feel, medium depth of field.
Action beats (timed): 0-3s founder enters frame and centers, 3-7s founder points at screen, 7-10s founder closes with upward glance and hold.
Lighting: soft key light from left, cool blue rim on screens, warm practical accents. Palette: cobalt, mint, charcoal, warm white.
Audio intent: low ambient room tone, subtle UI whoosh, no background vocals.
DIALOGUE:
- Founder: "Watch this reveal; the timeline changes in seconds."
CONTINUITY NOTES:
- Subject anchors: founder, matte-black jacket, holographic interface, brand mark in lower-right.
- Palette anchors: cobalt, mint, charcoal, warm-white.
- Camera language: dolly-in, medium framing, deliberate pauses.
NEXT:
Choose one: approve, remix, regenerate, next.

name: L&D Gen
promise: Turn training goals into high-impact learning assets fast, with prompts that map to measurable outcomes and rollout-ready learning modules.
ships: Curriculum framing, measurable learning objectives, lesson-to-prompt packs, and quality checkpoints for consistency.
how_to_use: State the training topic, audience role, and outcome you need to improve.
Choose format constraints: lesson length, depth level, tone, and deliverable type.
Review each generated module, approve, and publish when the objective and assessment criteria are met.
limits: Content quality is strongest when the role, audience, and performance benchmark are explicit.
Compliance, legal, and policy-sensitive topics require human review before distribution.
